newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Nasan Group to sell off Hangil stake.
newsitem.headline: Nasan Group to sell off Hangil stake.

text.p: South Korea's Nasan Group said on Tuesday it would sell its 38.91 percent stake in Hangil Merchant Banking Corp.
Unlisted Sung Won Corp and its three affiliates agreed to buy the Hangil stake at 90 billion won, or about 50,280 won per share, a Nasan group spokesman said.
Hangil shares closed on Tuesday at 7,920 won.
Nasan had purchased its stake in Hangil over the counter and in the open market since last May to participate in the financial firm's management.
The spokesman said Nasan decided to sell off the stake to concentrate on its core business sectors of clothing manufacturing and marketing and construction.
Sung Won is a medium-sized construction firm but a different company from Sungwon Corp, he said. The Nasan Group's flagship is Nasan Co, formerly called Nasan Industrial Co.
